intro: Cordemoya eucausta, commonly known as the Brazilian cordemoya, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous coating. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid, lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a garden plant.
